alert.note: Alert for Greenville; Pickens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 03 at 5:06PM EDT until August 03 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Greenville County in upstate South Carolina... Northeastern Pickens County in upstate South Carolina... * Until 1100 PM EDT. * At 506 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area with flash flooding imminent. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen on top of heavy rainfall from earlier this morning. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Areas of greatest flood concern are around Pumpkintown and within the Oolenoy River basin, including along and near Table Rock Rd, Oolenoy Church Rd, Dalton Rd, Pace Bridge Rd, and Pumpkintown Hwy. Please avoid all low-water crossings and low-spots near area streams for the next few hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Common, deeper flash-flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to area streams is developing with lesser impacts to vulnerable property. Expect extensive flash flooding of farmland, parks, greenways, boat- access areas, and golf courses. Inundation may be several feet deep. Other flood-prone areas will be impacted including low-lying roadways, low-water crossings, underpasses, and parking lots. Several low- water crossings, roads, and bridges may be flooded and impassible, with deeper flows over roadways possible. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Travelers Rest, Slater-Marietta, Table Rock State Park, Pumpkintown, Cleveland and Sunset. Heavy rainfall is subsiding and additional heavy rainfall is not expected. However, it will take several hours for the excessive runoff to subside and streams to rise, crest, and subside. Please exercise extreme caution in this area through the evening hours. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
